Decompression API

This page documents all decompression-related functions in compressionz. Each codec has its own module with tailored APIs.

Codec-Specific Decompression

Section titled “Codec-Specific Decompression”

Zstd

Section titled “Zstd”

DecompressOptions

Section titled “DecompressOptions”

LZ4 Frame

Section titled “LZ4 Frame”

LZ4 Block

Section titled “LZ4 Block”

LZ4 block format requires the original size for decompression:

Snappy

Section titled “Snappy”

Gzip

Section titled “Gzip”

Zlib

Section titled “Zlib”

Brotli

Section titled “Brotli”

Decompression Bomb Protection

Section titled “Decompression Bomb Protection”

Malicious compressed data can expand to enormous sizes (e.g., a 1 KB “zip bomb” expanding to 1 TB). Use max_output_size to protect against this:

Recommended Limits

Section titled “Recommended Limits”
ContextRecommended Limit
User uploads10-100 MB
API requests1-10 MB
Config files1 MB
Internal dataBased on expected size

Zero-Copy Decompression

Section titled “Zero-Copy Decompression”

Some codecs support decompressing into pre-allocated buffers:

LZ4 Block

Section titled “LZ4 Block”

LZ4 Frame

Section titled “LZ4 Frame”

Snappy

Section titled “Snappy”

Streaming Decompression

Section titled “Streaming Decompression”

For large data, use streaming APIs:

Gzip

Section titled “Gzip”

Zstd

Section titled “Zstd”

LZ4 Frame

Section titled “LZ4 Frame”

Brotli

Section titled “Brotli”

Zlib

Section titled “Zlib”

Automatically detect and decompress:

See Codec Detection for details.

See Error Handling for complete error reference.

Feature Support Matrix

Section titled “Feature Support Matrix”
CodecOne-shotStreamingZero-copyDictionaryRequires Size
